file_content.text: I look forward to tomorrow's session, Senator.
I brought what you asked.
My thanks. The best part of public office is interacting with the citizenry, wouldn't you say, Senator?
My work doesn't leave me much time for hand shakes and baby-kissing.
A moment.
Yes. Those look like the bills. By tomorrow morning you will see this scandal in the headlines. And a healthy "thank you" in your accounts.
Those are the bills, yes. By tomorrow, friend, this scandal will make headlines. And my gratitude will be in your account.
One wonders where the Black Sun receives such funding, no?
The war is over. The treaty holds. We must turn our attention here! These Black Sun must be stopped. Don't you agree, Senator?
It is not simple. The Senate must balance many priorities....
Oh, excuse me. An old friend....
That was a fairly unsubtle attempt to get my attention.
What do you want?
Oh, but I represent the Republic. And I've heard you're a friend to our interests. I thought you might help me out.
I'm not your friend.
Senator Nalrin Daheel, representative of the wisdom and beauty of the Ugnaught people.
I don't get involved in politics.
I'm not interested.
And what of crime?
That is Senator Gunaray Dod. The great lout is more than ugly. He's corrupt right up to those tiny ears.
He's been paying the Black Sun to harass his political opponents and has blocked all attempts to curb their violence. But I can make no formal accusation without proof.
To stand against the Empire, the Republic's leaders must be strong.
I will help you.
As I say, every world can do no better than to look to the example of the Ugnaughts!
If this is true, it is my duty to unveil this corruption.
I will help.
Your honesty provides you the dignity of an Ugnaught.
I don't want some corrupt Senator ordering me into battle.
Tell me what you need.
We have always been peaceable. Under our lead, you would see no battles.
What do you need? Incriminating photos? Dirty holocalls?
You want me to make proof?
I do not ask you to lie!
Why tell me?
Dod is paying the Black Sun with Kavin bills, an ancient currency from his homeworld that is almost never found elsewhere.
If you find Black Sun thugs in possession of these bills, it is all I need. And no one would mourn if your search cleared our streets of gangsters.
Bring me any Kavin bills you find. I will see you rewarded with far more than their worth in credits.
I'm not getting involved in some... it said-it said.
Forget it. [Refuse quest]
Fine! But it is your tax credits you waste.
Where were we, friend? Discussing the deplorable state of Coruscant, no?
It's an embarrassment to have these Black Sun loose in the capital!
